title: 105_hr2600
content: Repeal of incentive payments for reducing the number of graduate medical education residents. Repeal of payment authority for New York Demonstration Project under the Balanced Budget Act of 1997, eliminating additional payments for residency training beginning July 1, 1998. The text chunk states the repeal of payment authority for a New York Demonstration Project under the Balanced Budget Act of 1997, which eliminates additional payments for residency training starting July 1, 1998. It also mentions a reduction in the number of residents in a medical residency training program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The curr_chunk states "SEC. 2. PAYMENT OFFSETS." The curr_chunk clarifies that the April 1995 interpretation of the Social Security Act regarding ESRD Secondary Payer shall not apply retroactively to group health plans that paid benefits primary to title XVIII between August 10, 1993, and April 24, 1995. It also extends COBRA continuation coverage for End Stage Renal. The curr_chunk extends COBRA continuation coverage for End Stage Renal Disease Medicare beneficiaries for 36 months by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The curr_chunk amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to include provisions for qualified beneficiaries under section 226A of the Social Security Act. The curr_chunk includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act regarding beneficiaries entitled to benefits under section 226A of the Social Security Act for a period of 36 months. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act extend the Medicare ESRD Secondary Payer period to 36 months for qualified beneficiaries entitled to benefits under section 226A of the Social Security Act. Effective date applies to individuals becoming eligible for benefits on or after the enactment date of the Act.
